page.title: 02ECOLOGY FIELD TRIP
page.content: Today 30th May,1985 we went on a field trip to the Dornoch Links. It was very noisy because the R.A.F. jets were on practice bombing runs over the firth. We saw common and black backed gulls, an oyster catcher wading in the burn and a skylark was singing. The dunes are covered in marram grass and many rabbit burrows. Amongst the grass we found common wild flowers such as meadow buttercup, birds foot trefoil, vetch and speedwell. Later we walked across moorland to Loch an Treel. The ground is peaty and mostly covered in gorse,heather or reeds where it is boggy. Curlews and seagulls were nesting in the heather. Seagulls can be a nuisance because they attack lambs and damage young tree plantions. The numbers of seagulls are increasing every year so some of the eggs are destroyed to control the population.
